Till now Ram management is goodTo much hype created every where for this phone and due to this many user like me has purchased this phone but this phone under 25k is really not value for money. text: All aspects of the phone is on par or above the next segment. Lookwise it doesn't feel like an M series phone. FP sensor works well although it can store only 3 fingerprints. (you get reverse charging as well).The only con i felt till now is the exclusion of a phone cover in the box. 50Rs??M31s is actually A51 without on screen fp. It has better specs than A51 which retails around 8-9k than M31s which makes this phone one of a kind. The dimensions are also the same as A51. So you can use the same tempered glass but cant use A51 back cover for M31s since it should have the cutout for side mounted fp scanner. Overall a great phone.

text: Pros:1)

Clean and bloatfree OxygenOS, which runs as smooth as they come.2) AMOLED screen and 90Hz refresh rate really go along to make the display above average.3) 4K video recording @ 60fps is absent but 1080@60fps performance is quite good. The plastic frame (doesn't look like plastic but it is) is a worrying thing and makes the phone *comparatively* less durable.6) Fingerprint scanner being under the screen isn't as quick as a traditional fingerprint scanner on the back. Recommendation: If you're looking for a phone which delivers high performance and smooth interface for your daily use, go for it.

(The camera is better than most phones out there but it isn't what we were promised)2) (Pixel 4a is about to release, that's far better probably)Update: Pixel 4a camera is surely much better that Nord's camera.

Battery usage update: Drains faster than other one plus models...so for the ones travelling frequently, this might not be an ideal phone...fast charging is a relief for ones who have access to charging point.... And for those who can afford and dont mind a heavy phone(200+ gms), One plus 8 pro or 8T Pro would be ideal ones.(As per Amazon reviews some users are reporting display issues with 8 pro, so 8T Pro hopefully will be a better model.)
Morning to Night usage possible with moderate to slightly heavy usage....

StillI am satisfied with what I got here✌️*UPDATED*•Excellent charging speed(Thanks to Warp charge, 10 to 100 in less than an hour)•Battery backup is so good for daily users. Lasts almost a day.•No serious heating issues at all.•This is a mid-range phone(one of the best) and should not expect a monster perfomance from it.•One of the best choice as a daily-driver( If heavy perfomance is not your priority)

Reducing to 60Hz refresh rate would help.- Good Build Quality .- in-screen Finger print sensor is OK-OK.- Useless 5G- I am fan of stock android feel , one of the reason to buy this phone . Hence if you are using 5T or later and you are looking to update then don't think about it. My last hope is on software updates.
the one thing that annoys me is 64 gb is way too low storage, where 20 used by system itself and then welcome to bloatware ..

Due to something or the other defects (like headache giving screens, line marks at the back of the body, etc) as it's expensive!Phone boxes were puffed, torned, some displays were dull if noticed closely, more warm and yellowish. My 5th device came altogether from a different location, excellent box, phone built and display feels more broader even with same dimensions, no two parallel lines design or defect at the back, it's clean and curvy like OnePlus 8 8gb variant (mine is the 6gb one). Screen display is still more warm which I didn't want but colors are very punchy and clearly shows the display is far better than previous returned devices.1st OnePlus 8 8gb - Had a very long permanent line mark at the back of the body if looked closely.2nd OnePlus 8 8gb - Display's blue light filter had issues I'm sure as it gave me headache in seconds, eye strain as well.3rd OnePlus 8 6gb - 2 parallel lines on edges of the back body if the device was tilted a little, was like a dent kind of design or defect (I believe though this one had the best display even than the 5th one that I'm keeping and However, I'm tierd and somewhat satisfied but will want OnePlus to correct if possible with software update without compromising any quality of the display. It's said that Apple never compromises on quality, they even delay their production if they find any imperfections (I don't like iOS or use Apple though).

On the first glance you will feel the premium quality of the Oneplus 8.I have mentioned few good and bad points for quick understanding for every buyer -Good -Very good build qualityVivid displayExcellent performance and softwareSolid battery lifeDecent camera performanceChic designConsistent performanceOxygen OS is blissClass-leading displayBad-No IP rating or wireless chargingLow-light video could be betterBasic cameras setup

Obviously, you might have done extensive research, watched many review videos before coming here to make your purchase decision. There have been few software updates and I can confidently say that yes, the camera is neither great nor is it bad.
Day to day, if this is what is most important to you, then this is the device to get.

My experience with the device says that most of the reviews or unboxing things are influenced. The last OnePlus phone I was using was Oneplus 5 and was quite happy with it until it screen got broken and replacement cost was higher than the selling price of the device itself. All those time I teased my iPhone or Samsung Series colleagues and friends for their battery life. It will give you fluid experience but the soon it consumes battery you will always prefer to keep it to 60hz which is an option given in the display settings. Not for people who are on the move most of the time. Now they are launching 7t pro on Oct 10 again it is a disappointment for those who bought 7t on day 1. Maybe their R&D or trials have some problem here that in every two months they are launching a new device with an update to the previous faults.
model: OnePlus 7T (Glacier Blue, 8GB RAM, Fluid AMOLED Display, 256GB Storage, 3800mAH Battery)

text: The battery life does not last really long when you use it on 120 Hz QHD+, although it's quite manageable and can get through the day with mid usage easily. I've played PUBG quite a lot on this device and have not noticed any major frame drops at HDR graphics and Extreme frame rates, let alone Smooth graphics. Videos are very stable though. This has come close to the iPhone cameras as a video shooter. This might even offer better stabilization than the iPhone videos. This could be seen while watching Youtube videos in non-fill screen mode or videos that have any kind of frame visible or even games like PUBG where static elements of game like the map's frame or your controls would be visible on certain background colours even after you have turned the game off.

Warp 30T Technology.+ Brighter Nits (Upto 1000 compared to 800 of 7 Pro)+ Super Macro Mode, Night reading Modes, Android 10 out of the box, Better Nightscape 2.0. These software updates will be eventually updated for the 7 Pro as well.==== I'm personally not a fan of notches nor do I click a lot of selfies, so I prefer the OnePlus 7T Pro's Fluid Display. It still uses the Sony IMX 586 (48 MP) for it's main sensor and it's Telephoto at 2.2X optical (3X lossless) and is at par with iPhone. Software ====This is one of the biggest features for you to switch to the OnePlus. Stock Android was butter smooth while I missed out on a lot of simple gestures like Longer Screenshots, Silence Button, Customized Navigational elements & much more which lacked on the Stock OS from Google. I would say Oxygen OS should be set as a benchmark for Google to include these incremental features on their upcoming flagships. Oxygen OS has presently the best OS Experience for Android.==== Battery ====Warp T30 is super fast. ROG 2 is hands down the best gaming phone with 120 HZ Display but lacks majorly on other aspects like software updates, Telephoto Camera, Splash Proof, Build Quality and security patches which are very essential for business professionals or regular consumers. ASUS is also not known to provide regular updates to it's consumers over the OnePlus which has a closely knit community among the developers and has more Brand Value than ASUS & nevertheless to mention that the OnePlus 7T Pro feels premium out of the box. If you're planning to upgrade from a device almost 2 years old then this would be the best upgrade in case you require a phone with no-notch and curved screen. If you still wish to own this but cannot afford the extra rupee on incremental updates (Fast Charging, 855 Plus) , my suggestion would be is to go for the OnePlus 7 Pro.
model: OnePlus 7T Pro (Haze Blue, 8GB RAM, Fluid AMOLED Display, 256GB Storage, 4085mAH Battery)

text: COD & PUB-G juices out at their best with 60FPS & is indeed smooth than imagined. Nightscape is now available for Wide Angle shots too.==== Video ====If you're into Video Recording, then be a bit disappointed to hear this as it isn't the best while it can still take average videos without much shake utilizing the OIS and EIS at 1080P and just OIS at 4K 60FPS. The videos look oversaturated too which can be fixed by shooting on a Third Party app like Filmic Pro.====

It wasn't expected from one plus,I am facing the same issue which is experienced by most users on one plus 8 pro ,something which is called black bar issue near front facing camera when brightness of the phone is set to low,really not expected one plus.

Believe me guys, Oxygen OS is by far the best skin for Android. Oxygen OS is still just awesome.- Also, watch YT videos in landscape mode.- Lack of the 3.5mm headphone jack is the biggest let down for me in this phone.
Focus jumps quite a lot in tricky lighting. Also, the camera bump is quite prominent.-
I'm yet to test a lot of things, will update after a few days of usage.

I bought the oneplus 8 pro selling my DSLR camera so that I can record all my videos on phone itself plus its waterproof. Now whats the use if I cant record a video even for few minutes straight on 4K?Camera - To be honest, stabilization is really great while recording video however photos are almost as good as oneplus 5 if not slightly better. Fingerprint lockscreen works mostly 70% of the time.
Since I travel long distances most of the days. Even the build quaility feels nice.
Pros - everything is perfect except display.
Black bar, black crush issue and red tint across the display. ( Attached photos for reference)2. ( clearly visible in the photos)3.
I was amazed by the youtube review videos about this phone.
Most features are just a gmmick to attract customers.
Sometimes it over expose images. But I think it will be fixed in the future update.

The touch is super smooth, face unlock is fast as a blink of an eye, I constantly use google assistant which response pretty well, I am blown away with the camera quality and audio quality that is powered by Dolby Atmos. Apart from the strong base of hardware and software the phone has some pretty cool features that I have been loving for instance Digital Wellbeing, Work-Life Balance mode, Quick reply in landscape ,Zen Mode, customization for each application that helps in optimization and intelligent functioning. I have used this phone for my online meetings as well, the screen renders images and videos pretty well.

Awesome experience with ONEPLUS.Buttery smooth 90 hz display 😍Color accuracy and brightness of displayYou will be just in love with display of device. Haptic vibration feedback on ONEPLUS 8 is awesomeDevice is very light weight in hands. Cameras are decent and produce decent pictures in day light and struggle little bit in artificial lighting. Overall look , feel , battery and everything is great and cameras are decent for day to day usage. Juat go for Glacial Green Color. I was confused between onyx black and Glacial Green Glacial green is best color OnePlus ever made.
Not only this when I play game at bottom of the screen I can see some disturbance too which u can c in screenshots and videos I uploaded with the review.
OS :

( had also replaced the battery last year)Within 3 weeks I had done my research on various models at various price pointssome of the phones I considered wereMoto G5 plus----> excellent reviews all over, but camera is a compromiseMoto Z play------> good battery life...but specs wise ok and additionally it is made to support the moto mods so design looks funny with the pins at the backHonor Pro 8----> phone has some heating issues while using cameraOne Plus 5---> other than jelly effect no significant issues seen on the internetIPhone 6S ----> if IOS fan, then go for it but take the higher memory version as 32gb is too small for Ios apps. I will not speak about the specs as most reviews highlight it in detailwhat I liked!Blazing fast  while opening closing apps etcCamera is quite good! I would not rate it as good as pixel, but produces very acceptable quality in most lighting conditionsdesign is very slim. but I would recommend a case as it is slippery especially while trying to take selfiesVideos are with Electronic image stabilisation ( 4K too) which is brilliant!Dash charge is very good!latest OS 4.5.8 update is available also to downloadwhat I dislikedCamera app is very basic. Battery life is a question mark especially over 2-3 years as currently even with moderate usage It gets me through a day ( but most phones have this problem so its not a deal breaker )Display legibility is not great especially under direct sunlight. this could be corrected with adaptive brightness but then indoors it becomes too bright.so drains the batteryOther than display legibility most of the above cons can be fixed by software updates I guess.
Quick processor2.

OOS 4.5.x looks and feels better than the version in 3/3T. I am sure the little issues will be taken care of, soon.7. Camera is better than 3/3T. Videos look great after update. Inbuilt equalizer is the worst there is. An update can easily fix that.4.

OS:The Oxygen OS software has been updated to Oreo in the last week that we have been using it. It adds some light, useful and tasteful customizations on top of stock Android that add value. It’s quite average in terms of loudness but the audio quality is reasonable. But After So Much Some Things Got Missed Like*OIS Camera Stabilizer*Not IPS Certified*2K Display Resolution*Also Dual Camera Needs Some FixesBut over all its a power packed phone with a reasonable price.#And 5T has made some improvements on camera which are missing on 5 but Front Fingerprint Scanner lover chosse
The telephoto lens will offer up to 2x zoom and both the lenses will combine together to capture impressive photos with a greater depth of field, akin to the portrait mode of the iPhone 7 Plus.3.

Dash charge is very fast, within 30 min it will be enough charged, but the software upgrade is little buggy, some apps gets crashed and a popup comes in saying "___ app has stopped, open again",camera in day is excellent, but night needs improvement.
Daylight photo quite good(samples attached).Night photo though manageable but not as great as samsung flagships.. Selfy photos are very nice..
It was difficult to get into Android after using iPhone, but never regret this buy for the below points.1. Good app interface, can't beat iPhone in this aspect, yet 1+ doesn't compromise.4.

Design-It's a pro or con depending on each user's, if you look pass the Appleish design the build quality is amazing .It has curved back which feels really good when you hold it in hand.2)Top notch specs.3) Stock Android with minimal bloat and fast updates (I have received 3 till now)4)No-heating issues-I have used this device for many days and I must say this device barely heats up while doing intensive tasks, thanks to the Snapdragon 835.5) Excellent Camera-Day light photography is excellent but in low light it's a hit or a miss.6)Fast fingerprint scanner.∆CONS∆1) Battery is not that great even with Full hd display (This could be fixed with an  software update)3)No Sd card slot.4) Price could have been less.
Oneplus support said take it to a service center but couldn't tell me the closest one.

text: It has got a decent battery backup, display's amazing (first time using an AMOLED display), the triple camera setup is quite useful and has good color reproduction but it somehow cannot try to get a good shot at night. I mean the pictures are not so bad, but there is definitely some tuning required to make the camera take good shots at night. PROS:--Supports fast charge and has pretty decent charge rates-Has NFC which enables in wireless payments and support for Android Beam (unless Android 10 comes)-Has a good 4000mAh battery, pretty decent for bit of heavy users-Has on-screen fingerprint which is good-Camera setup is goodCONS:--Camera struggles to shoot better pictures at night-The included night mode requires a little bit software upgrade-OneUI which is extremely good, but the icons are kind of kiddish-And mostly- Most of the cons are fixable by latter FOTA upgradesSo if you are looking for a budget option, go for itThis is my review after using the A30s for 3 months. Firstly speaking, samsung claims to have a 4000mAh battery, which sounds good but use it and you will feel that it is not actually keeping the charge for the required hoped time. But despite all of these, samsung strictly gets a plus mark for it's awesome update schedule.
model: Samsung Galaxy A30s (Prism Crush White, 4GB RAM and 128GB)

text: So let me provide you the Pros and Cons of the phone -PROS... Doesn't misses out on any feature like reverse wireless charging, 5g support (though in India not of use for at least couple of years), NFC, Dual GPS, capable of being connected to wifi and provide Hotspot simultaneously, No MIUI ads till date. This phone comes with Global MIUI 11 and has Google dialer and messaging app thus misses out features like call recording, phone notes etc. 3. Trust me this MIUI has a lot of bugs and thus results in issues like while using finger print scanner, the device heats up at times even during normal usage, but the overall performance is acceptable. (Hopefully most of the issues will be resolved by MIUI 12 update which is going to be available soon)4. The battery is bigger compared to many devices but looses about 10 to 20% even when left untouched overnight thus I'd say not so good battery management.6. I think that the phone is slightly overpriced at 50k but if we compare it with it`s biggest competitor the One plus 8 I will always choose MI 10 as so many things are missing in One plus 8 (like wireless charging, LP DDR RAM 4x is present instead of 5, comes with smaller battery 4300mAH and Sony IMX 586 Camera sensor which is quite outdated now) and have a price difference of only 5k. However in comparison with One plus 8 pro I feel that MI 10 is slightly behind because of the MIUI bugs related flaws, FHD+ display and outdated secondary camera hardware (including front camera.
Nice built quality and comfortable to hold.2. (Better experience while watching videos or playing games)4.

text: Even after upgrading the ios to 12.0.1, there seems to be no difference, I think the screen could have been used to fit in more text compared to the Xs. having said that, im used to big phones, the Pixel 2xl, the 6sPlus, so if you are a big phone person, go for this phone with eyes closed. If you are confused between apple and android flagships, let me tell you, I was on HTC for 3 years, then shifted to iphone 6s plus for 3 years and briefly shifted to pixel 2 xl, and  now finally to Xs Max, which I intend to use for the next 3 years. having used both, I definitely feel iphones are quite premium and offer the best tech. Almost all phones come with these features these days and after adapting to iphones technology, the other phones are going a step ahead, so definitely, apple is the trend setter! Also great touch interface! and now I know why some people are reluctant to switch to android from iphone!

For the record, Apple will support this phone with software updates for 5 years...the Note 9 is a 2018 phone running 2017 Android software and Samsung gives software updates for 3 years. I’ll list some pros and cons and also what the tech media won’t tell you. Pros:- battery life is all day- upgraded speakers get real loud- A case is almost mandatory especially if you are clumsyBottom line...the iPhone and Galaxy phones are the best phones on the market right now. The iPhone is a step ahead because iOS gets frequent updates and starting with iOS 12 Apple actually sped up old iPhones and iPads which will allow users to keep their devices longer. Android doesn’t have full screen built into the OS so video apps like HBO, Showtime, Cinemax, STARZ, Encore, and EPIC are all tiny on the Note 9...those apps are all full screen on the iPhone.

It’s an iPhoneGold colour colour done the job very wellA12 Bionic chip processor is strongBuilt quality is good then iphone xr and iphone 11Camera perfectPeople will love this 2camera design not the iPhone 11 pro max design
I purchased an Apple only after positive reviews from my friends and I am loving this so far.. 3 GB RAM in iphone x or 4 GB RAM here in iPhone XS is far better than 6 GB ram in a Samsung..

When I inquired about Apple Care protection on the device, he mentioned that Apple does not have any warranty against Screen damages in India and it is available in US and other countries.1. Is Apple expecting its users to change the phone which costs almost 1 lakh just becuse there is a crack on the screen?2. One Plus is providing free screen replacement warranty for a year that costs half the price of iPhone.3. Apple gadgets users are at a disadvantage if expensive costs for maintenance continues.
This might be best Camera in some scenarios, but for me it’s a total disappointment.

I identified issue with main camera)Contacted Apple service centre and their response is “that is how iPhone X & iPhone Xs designed”Raised issue to Apple customer care number and shared the sample pics and other required data to analyse. I have seen similar post for iPhone Xs MAX with the same issue in apple forum and the final response from Apple is: check lighting while taking pics.

if you want to know specs and comparisons well you have youtube , there are plenty of reviews there but if you are ready to buy such an expensive piece without selling your kidney then those reviews and comparisons don't matter to you
After talking to Apple representative, i only got indefinite answer like it could be software issue and i should wait till it updates but Amazon return/replace policy valid for only 10 days.

Being an utter working middle class guy, I don't switch my iPhones very often (my android phones barely lasted me 9 months though). With exchange offer, it cost me a little over 60K. For the price (and that price only), this makes it worth the buy.- Considering the XR is now priced higher than X. XS is only marginally better, and didn't feel it was worth the extra 30K.- Even after a year of being on the market, this phone is an absolute beast in terms of performance, especially after iOS 12.- The Camera is a beauty.
Pros:- If you record 4K videos, it will eat up your storage really quickly.- Videos get heavily cropped when watching in full screen mode.
